description.narrative: The main project-level outcomes are the environmental impact by displacing GHG emissions and the stakeholder impact by helping meet India's increasing electricity demand. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will improve market integration by enabling the generation and transmission of power from renewable rich states to renewable deficient states through the national grid. The Project will also increase market competitiveness by demonstrating scaling up of a new and efficient module technology to meet ambitious national targets.

The proposed project involves a debt investment in Thar Surya 1 Pvt. Ltd. (Project Company) to finance the construction of a 300 MWac solar PV project in Bikaner, Rajasthan, India (Project). The Project is being developed by one of the step-down subsidiaries of Enel Green Power S.p.A., an existing global client of IFC. The Project was awarded to the Project Company in July 2020 by Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) and the Project will sell the generated electricity to SECI under a 25 year PPA. IFC is the mandated lead arranger for the entire debt portion.
